data.Notes: One of four current bills whose passage would trigger a constitutional referendum on sex abuse statute of limitations.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Create a two year window for childhood victims of sexual abuse to file a lawsuit against their abusers or those who shielded them

data.Notes: Must be approved in special session to reach voters. One of four current bills whose passage would trigger a constitutional referendum on sex abuse statute of limitations.

actions.description: PN 0006 Referred to THE COMMITTEE TO PROVIDE JUSTICE TO OTHERWISE BARRED VICTIMS OF CHILDHOOD SEXUAL ABUSE

data.Status: Passed state House, awaiting vote in the state Senate
data.WhatWouldItDo: Create a two year window for childhood victims of sexual abuse to file a lawsuit against their abusers or those who shielded them

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for proposal of amendments by the General Assembly and their adoption.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Require constitutional amendments pass the General Assembly with a two-thirds vote, rather than the current simple majority

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for disqualifications for service as election officer.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow government employees to serve as poll workers

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for the maintenance and support of public education.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Mandate state education dollars be allocated to students, not to school districts

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for terms of members.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Term limit state senators to three consecutive four-year terms and state represenstatives to six consecutive two-year terms.

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for compensation and retirement of justices, judges and justices of the peace.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow the General Assembly to lower judicial salaries during the budget process independent of other public officials salaries

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for tenure of justices, judges and justices of the peace.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Limit Supreme Court justices to two 10-year terms

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for judicial administration.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow the General Assembly to choose which county's courts hear civil cases

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for sessions of the General Assembly.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Move legislative swearing-in day from the first Tuesday in January to Dec. 1 after each election.

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for right to medical freedom.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Guarantee a right to refuse any medical treatment, including vaccines

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for legislative districts.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Shrink the state House from 203 to 151 members

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for expiration of authority to levy or collect real property taxes.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Eliminate all local property taxes by June 2027, replacing them with state or local sales and income taxes

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for removal of civil officers.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Require lawmakers to resign upon being convicted of a crime, rather than upon being sentenced as under current law

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for tenure of justices, judges and justices of the peace.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Reduce all judicial terms to six years

data.Notes: While voter ID language passed last year in SB 106, Zimmerman's language is different from last year's language

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for qualifications of electors.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Require all voters to show ID every time they vote in person and by mail; require signature verification of mail ballots; require voters be registered 30 days before an election rather than the current 15

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for exemptions and special provisions relating to taxation.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow the General Assembly to set up a program to reduce the property tax burden on certain individuals

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for exemptions and special provisions.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Extend an existing state property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans to include those who are 50% disabled, and remove a requirement that the disability must stem from war time

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for method of elections and secrecy in voting.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Eliminate no excuse mail voting

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for exemptions and special provisions.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Remove restrictions on an existing state property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans and remove a requirement that the disability must stem from war time

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for spending limitations on the Commonwealth.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Tie state budget increases to the rate of inflation and population growth unless two-thirds of the General Assembly agrees otherwise

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for personal reproductive liberty.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Guarantee a right to abortion and all other forms of reproductive health care

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for workers' rights.

actions.description: PN 0937 Referred to LABOR AND INDUSTRY

data.WhatWouldItDo: Add a right to organize a union and collectively bargain to the state constitution and prohibit the passage of any law interferring with that right

data.Notes: Passed Senate in January 2023 combined with language to allow the General Assembly to override a regulation with a simple majority vote and to authorize a two year civil window for sex abuse survivors. House stripped out voter ID and regulatory language in committee in March 2023. Measure must be approved again by Senate to reach ballot. One of four current bills whose passage would trigger a constitutional referendum on sex abuse statute of limitations.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Create a two year window for childhood victims of sexual abuse to file a lawsuit against their abusers or those who shielded them

data.Notes: Standalone amendment. Passed last year combined with amendments that would declare there's no legal right to an abortion, give new regulatory override powers to the legislature, allow the governor to pick a running mate, and create a universal voter ID requirement.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Require that Pennsylvania's auditor general conduct annual election audits

data.WhatWouldItDo: Remove restrictions on an existing state property tax exemption for 100% disabled veterans and remove a requirement that the disability must stem from war time

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for expiration of authority to levy or collect real property taxes on homesteads and farmsteads.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Eliminate local property taxes on homesteads and farmsteads by June 2028, replacing them with state or local sales and income taxes

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for pardoning power and Board of Pardons.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Reduce the vote requirement for Pennsylvania's Board of Pardons to pardon a prisoner, from unanimous to four out of five members

data.Notes: Standalone amendment. Passed last year combined with amendments that would declare there's no legal right to an abortion, allow the governor to pick a running mate, impose new election audits, and create a universal voter ID requirement.

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for action on concurrent orders and resolutions.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow the General Assembly to override a regulation with a simple majority vote

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for spending limitations.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Restrict state budget increases to the rate of inflation plus average population change, or the average state personal income unless two-thirds of the General Assembly agrees to waive the cap

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, prohibiting the passage of unfunded directives from the General Assembly concerning education passed through legislation.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Require the state to fund any new education program established by statute, regulation or executive order that costs school districts money

data.Notes: One of four current bills whose passage would trigger a constitutional referendum on sex abuse statute of limitations.

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for courts to be open and suits against the Commonwealth.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Create a two year window for childhood victims of sexual abuse to file a lawsuit against their abusers or those who shielded them

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for tenure of justices, judges and justices of the peace.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Limit state Supreme, Superior and Commonwealth Court justices to two ten-year terms.

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for judicial administration.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow all state courts with more than two members, except the Supreme Court, to elect their president judge rather than using seniority

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for appropriation bills.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Require a gubernatorial request for a department budget supplement be made through a separate bill rather than in the next year's budget

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for legislative districts.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Shrink state House from 203 to 150 members; ensure each state Senate district contains three state House districts

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for prohibition against denial or abridgment of equality of rights because of sex.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Expand state non-discrimination protections to include sexual orientation and gender idenitity

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, providing for minimum wage.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Set minimum wage at $15 effective Jan. 1, 2025, followed by automatic increases to keep pace with inflation

data.Notes: Standalone amendment. Passed last year combined with amendments that would declare there's no legal right to an abortion, give new regulatory override powers to the legislature, impose new election audits, and create a universal voter ID requirement.

OpenStatesInfo.title: A Joint Resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, further providing for Lieutenant Governor.

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow the gubernatorial candidate to pick a candidate for lieutenant governor as a running mate, eliminating independent primaries for the two offices

data.WhatWouldItDo: Allow the General Assembly to set up a program to reduce the property tax burden on certain individuals
